title: Doyers Street
address: Doyers St, New York, NY  10013, United States
desc: Explore the history of Doyers Street in Chinatown, New York City.
tnalt: A screenshot of a table overlayed in Doyer St.
intro: An augmented reality experience that invites participants to explore the history of Doyers Street in Chinatown, New York City and the inter-generational struggles of Chinese Americans. Widely considered the “nerve center” of Chinatown in Manhattan, Doyers Street is a site full of rich stories with a history spanning over a century. From gang wars in the early 1900s to Covid-19, Doyers Street and its Chinatown residents have faced numerous challenges throughout the years.
detail: Set in a fictional family restaurant on Doyers Street, the story follows the journey of the restaurant as it strives to survive through the decades. Told through the lens of the current owner of the restaurant in three time periods, 1910, 1975, and 2020, each owner narrates the current issues of the time revealing the inter-generational struggles and experiences that affected many in Chinatown, tying past histories to present issues. Divided into three parts, participants scan QR codes placed throughout the street to activate each of the three AR experiences. In the experience, participants can read (in English) and listen (in Cantonese) to the main character narrating the specific issues of their time relating to Chinatown, the restaurant business, and Chinese American struggles.

title: MetroArchive
address: 2 Doyers St, New York, NY  10013, United States
desc: An immersive AR experience that enables users to view historic New York City streets as they were a century ago.
intro: Users can participate in the experience by visiting Chinatown's Doyers Street, or by engaging with a magazine printout using a mobile device.
detail: Whether you're a tourist, an educator, or a local, the Metro ARchive offers a fresh perspective on streets that deserve a second glance. The experience unites education, entertainment, and social justice by putting the narrative at the forefront.

title: 4.0 Networked Ecosystem
desc: Networked Ecosystem is a live-simulation environment that presents an ecosystem built of a variety of digital senses.
intro: Networked Ecosystem is a live-simulation environment that presents an ecosystem built of a variety of digital senses. Commissioned by NEW INC, Rhizome and Nokia Bell Labs, Networked Ecosystem takes machine vision and sensing data collected by Bell Lab’s experimental robots and sensors and repurposes it to drive a 3D environmental simulation.
detail: In Networked Ecosystem, natural phenomena have been replaced by digital and artificial systems as forces that drive development: Electricity/battery = sustenance, WIFI signals = nutrition, Lidar data = fire/heat. Data Organisms populate this digital ecosystem as native life forms in the form of bots, AI’s, and avatars. Visitors to this networked landscape develop new kinds of digital senses to experience data as environmental changes, and interact with the simulated world and each other in an ever-changing online environment.

title: IMAGINARY FRIEND
address: 820 Washington St, New York, NY 10014, United States
desc: Imaginary Friend is an augmented reality work of a imaginary friend who
intro: Imaginary Friend tells us of a story in which a character, reminiscent of a religious figure like a sage, tries to give a blessing to a friend, but he refuses it as he doesn’t believe anything good will happen to him.
detail: The character leaves us with the phrase ‘sometimes we believe nothing good can ever happen to us, so it don’t’. Abney was inspired by fairy godmothers from cartoons that come into play to offer guidance. This story can be interpreted in multiple ways given our circumstances in the current world and Abney hopes it raises questions.

title: ABC Corner
address: 44 Kent St, Brooklyn, NY 11222, United States
desc: Make learning the alphabet an interactive and fun part of the commute.
tnalt: A screenshot of a big letter A and an alien in a yellow suit on the corner of a preschool.
intro: The goal of the project is to make early learners excited about learning. It aims to make a typical part of the day a delightful educational experience.
detail: The project is ongoing, with a letter released every week. The goal of the project is to make preschoolers excited about learning. It aims to  make a typical part of the day a delightful educational experience for kids and parents.

title: Metagarden
desc: Metagarden is an Augmented Reality portal that opens up to a surreal garden in 360.
tnalt: Screenshot of a digital garden overlayed in a portal in the middle of the real world.
intro: Metagarden is an Augmented Reality portal that opens up to a surreal garden in 360. The user can navigate the liminal space and get lost in this immersive and magical den.

title: Dreamground
address: 837 Washington St, New York City, NY 10014-1307
desc: Dreamground is a physical and digital playground, connecting physical structures, on-screen animation and AR.
intro: Add your own virtual elements to the sculptures. Place and spawn interactive elements on any surface or draw midair to make custom floating creations.
detail: At Hollywood Park and Samsung 837, there are sculptures and floating portals that allow you to explore immersive worlds around you via your smartphone. Look for Bubbloonland, Fluttering Forest, and Crystal Galaxy and see what other visitors have created in the space before you. At both locations, visitors can place Dreamground AR elements around them, see creations left behind by others or collaborate together with other visitors in real-time.

title: Portal - AI Generated Image Textures
desc: This experiment involves the users camera perspective to reveal an AI generated image from the falling blocks.
intro: The AR experience includes a bunch of falling cubes that align in such a way to create an image.
detail: The user must move the camera to match the correct perspective to see the image in its entirety. This experience includes real-time reflections, baked physics simulations and Dalle2 generated images. All textures in this AR experience were created from AI. Textures were created using Dalle2 then added as texture maps to 3D models.

title: Totem
desc: “Totem” is an AR monument, a re-imagining of public sculptural art when including augmented reality capabilities.
intro: “Inspired by the aesthetics of many urban artworks such as Cloud Gate (Anish Kapoor, Chicago), David created the scuplture in a metallic look of “Totem” to feel familiar and at home in a modern city environment.
detail: When making it, I wanted to ask, “what could a public art sculpture look and behave like if it had the unreal qualities of AR?”, “how would I invite the public to interact with the sculpture?”. “Totem” consists of 7 individual stacked prisms that float and tilt at an unreal angle. When each prism is tapped, they rotate, with each ascending prism rotating faster than the previous one. With “Totem”, I wanted to imagine future possibilities where cities seamlessly incorporate AR public artworks with the real world, a time when a digital sculpture may sit next to a real world sculpture and becomes a natural part of the environment.

title: ReWildAR
requirements: AR Poise App and Location Coordinates
desc: ReWildAR is an augmented reality experience that will expand how you see the world as you “see” into the vast surreal future landscape in real time and space.
intro: transforms into an overgrown wildflower meadow, bursting with virtual flowers and insects

title: A Tiny Frog's Climb
intro: An augmented reality filter for NYT Kids on the launch of “Tiny Issue.” A real-scale immersive rainforest environment to show the journey of the tiny strawberry poison frog.

title: Placekeeping in Chinatown
desc: A collection of AR experiences that present these stories of resilience and resistance to help viewers unpack the lived experience of evictions and gentrification
intro: Placekeeping in Chinatown - Here To Stay, a multimedia project, will center the stories of people most directly impacted by displacement, with the long term goal of protecting and preserving our beloved neighborhood.
detail: This new initiative will be a bilingual project featuring short video and audio testimonials from tenants telling their own stories. Interactive media like Augmented Reality and online mapping will be used to present these stories of resilience and resistance to help viewers unpack the lived experience of evictions and gentrification. It is not just about preserving the facade of buildings but about keeping cultural memories associated with a place alive, keeping local businesses and community centers open, and keeping tenants who have raised their families in their homes. This project will also highlight the organizing history and building campaigns of the Chinatown Tenants Union (CTU).

title: Lotus Meditation
address: Japan, 〒605-0811 Kyoto, Higashiyama Ward, Komatsucho, ５８４番地
desc: An immersive lotus meditation experience that helps you meditate.
intro: Lotus Meditation was developed for the Art Innovation exhibition and symposium, jointly held by Kyoto University and Goldsmiths University of London art college. It is geolocated in Chuo-on-tei, the 'Garden of the Sound of the Tide,' in Kennin-ji, the oldest Zen temple in Kyoto. When you start the app, you will be surrounded by small lotus flowers.
detail: If you view one of the flowers in the exact middle of your smartphone display, it enlarges to embrace you, revealing its secret treasure: Eisai, the founder of Kennin-ji and the monk who brought both tea and Zen to Japan. As you trigger more of the flowers, you will be surrounded by Eisai's images in gold. This is not easy: you must quiet your mind and focus on the lotus, cupping it gently in your hands!

title: Walk in my Shoes
desc: An engaging Web AR experience that gives an insight into what it is like to be young and homeless.
tnalt: A hand holding a phone looking at a 3D unhoused girl overlayed on a real street.
intro: As you walk through the designated areas, you will see the world from the perspective of the girl, experiencing the sights and sounds of the streets through her eyes. You will encounter the harsh realities of homelessness, from the struggle to find food and shelter to the constant fear of violence and abuse.
detail: Through interactive elements and dialogue, you will have the opportunity to engage with the girl and learn about her story. You will discover the challenges she faces on a daily basis and the resilience she must summon to survive. The experience will be designed in collaboration with unhoused individuals, community organizations, and experts in the field of homelessness. The goal is to create an experience that is both educational and empathetic, shedding light on the complex social and economic factors that contribute to homelessness and the human cost of these issues.

title: Soul Stealer
desc: An augmented reality hidden role game set in ancient China, where players take on the roles of mysterious entities known as 'soul stealers.' These beings are said to be capable of capturing human souls and taking them to the underworld.
tnalt: A role card overlayed with a picture and description of the stonemason.
intro: In this game, players will assume the role of either a soul stealer or a human character. The objective of the soul stealers is to capture as many human souls as possible, while the humans must work together to uncover the identity of the soul stealers and protect themselves from being captured.
detail: Players will use their smartphones to view clues and see their roles in the game's augmented reality. As the game progresses, players will need to work together to decipher cryptic messages and unravel the mysteries of the soul stealers. At the same time, they must be wary of their fellow players, as some of them may be secretly working against them.'Soul Stealers' is a game of strategy, deduction, and deception, set in a richly detailed and immersive world inspired by ancient Chinese mythology. Will you be able to uncover the truth behind the myth of soul stealing, or will you become just another lost soul in the underworld? Play 'Soul Stealers' to find out.

title: Dango Bite
desc: An augmented reality front facing camera filter that allows you to eat Dango Mochi.
tnalt: A screenshot of a 3D model of dango mochi overlayed on a person's mouth.
intro: As you activate the filter, a virtual Dango Mochi will appear on your screen, hovering just in front of you. You can move your device or head around to get a better view of the mochi. You can also take a virtual bite out of the mochi, as if you were really eating it. Watch as your teeth sink into the chewy rice cake.
detail: You can share your virtual Dango Mochi with friends and family on social media, and even compare your 'bites' with theirs for a fun and interactive experience.

title: Fly the Niantic ARship!
desc: Take the Niantic ARship on a flight around your world. Click the link to launch the experience.
tnalt: A screenshot of a 3D model of dango mochi overlayed on a person's mouth.
intro: Fly the Niantic ARship! Take the Niantic ARship on a flight around your world. Click the link to launch the experience.
